Event.name: Request
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame a <fen>Speaker</fen> asks an <fen>Addressee</fen> for something, or to carry out some action.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">The customer</fex> <t>demanded</t> <fex name="Msg">a refund</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>begged</t> <fex name="Addressee">my parents</fex> <fex name="Message">to let me stay up late.</fex></ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">The judge</fex> <t>ordered</t> the plaintiff to return the money.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Addressee
Arg.definition:
<def-root>In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
<ex>The child <t>implored</t> <fex name="Addressee">her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.</ex> <ex>I <t>pleaded</t> <fex name="Addressee">with the bus driver</fex> to let me on without paying.</ex> <ex>I made an <t>appeal</t> <fex name="Addressee">to the passers-by</fex> to help me.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Message
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement. <ex><fex name="Message">"I'd like an extension,"</fex> <t>begged</t> Pat.</ex> <ex>The directors <t>requested</t> <fex name="Message">that Pat resign</fex>.</ex> <ex>Pat <t>begged</t> them <fex name="Message">to reconsider</fex>.</ex> <ex>The students <t>requested</t> <fex name="Message">an extension of the deadline</fex>.</ex> <ex>The offender <t>begged</t> <fex name="Message">for clemency</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is rarely expressed in this frame but can occur as a PP Complement headed by <ment>about</ment>.
<ex>Can <fex name="Speaker">I</fex> make a <t>request</t> <fex name="Topic">about the content of the lessons</fex>?.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>. <ex>The parents of the missing child made an <t>appeal</t> <fex name="Medium">on television</fex>.</ex> <ex>The parents of the missing child made an <t>appeal</t> <fex name="Medium">in the papers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Manner</fen> indicates the manner in which the <fen>Message</fen> is delivered.
<ex>Don't stop, " he <t>commanded</t> <fex name="Manr">huskily</fex>.</ex> <ex>"Maybe that was the basic problem," she <t>told</t> him <fex name="Manr">wearily</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen> that results in a request being made and received.
<ex>He <t>asked</t> for food <fex name="Mns">by holding his hand out with a doleful expression</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>urged</t> <fex name="Add">him</fex> <fex name="Message">to concede</fex> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that are expected to derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>asked</t> <fex name="Addressee">him</fex> <fex name="Message">to get that</fex> <fex name="Beneficiary">for you</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs, or a state of affairs that holds, at a time that includes some time that the request was occuring. This often makes us of "as" and "while".
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>asked</t> <fex name="Addressee">him</fex> <fex name="Message">for directions</fex> <fex name="Containing_event">while we waited</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The frame element <fen>Iterations</fen> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> <t>asked</t> <fex name="Iterations">twice</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target.
<ex><fex name="Depictive">Glancing out the window</fex>, <fex name="Speaker">she</fex> <t>asked</t> <fex name="Add">me</fex> <fex name="Message">to hand her the cane and assist her down the stairs</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: appeal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a serious or heartfelt request

lexUnit.name: ask.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: request to do or give something.

lexUnit.name: beg.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask for (something) earnestly or humbly

lexUnit.name: beseech.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask (someone) urgently and fervently for something.

lexUnit.name: command.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an authoratative order

lexUnit.name: command.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an authoritative or peremptory order

lexUnit.name: demand.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an insistent and peremptory request, made as of right.

lexUnit.name: demand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask authoritatively or brusquely

lexUnit.name: entreat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask (someone) earnestly or anxiously.

lexUnit.name: entreaty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a request

lexUnit.name: implore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: beg earnestly or desperately

lexUnit.name: order.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an authoritative command or direction

lexUnit.name: order.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give an authoritative command

lexUnit.name: petition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an appeal or request; a formal written request, typically signed by many people, appealing to authority in respect of a cause

lexUnit.name: plea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a request made in an urgent and emotional manner

lexUnit.name: plead.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an emotional appeal.

lexUnit.name: request.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: asking politely or formally for something

lexUnit.name: request.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: ask politely or formally in an effort to bring something about.

lexUnit.name: summon.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: authoritatively call on (someone) to be present

lexUnit.name: tell.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: instruct (someone) to do something

lexUnit.name: urge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: encourage or entreat earnestly to do something.

lexUnit.name: call.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: inspire or urge to do something

lexUnit.name: invite.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: request (something) formally or politely from someone.

lexUnit.name: call.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a request made in a relatively formal manner

lexUnit.name: instruct.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to order or command someone to do something

lexUnit.name: invitation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a request for someone to do something (usually, attend an event)
